name: VCO - Pulsar
description: This algorithm is based on the Pulsar VCO from the disting mk4 and implements pulsar synthesis inspired by Curtis Roads's book *Microsound* (MIT Press). It uses wavetables from an SD card as sources for 'pulsarets'â€”small sound grains repeated periodically with silence intervals. The algorithm controls timbre independently of pitch through two distinct frequency inputs: fundamental frequency (rate of pulsaret train generation) and formant frequency (playback speed of the pulsaret). When in 'Tracking' mode, changing the fundamental pitch also adjusts the formant pitch. Masking modes include Stochastic (random masking based on a percentage) and Burst (grouped masking with adjustable burst length). The GUI displays a single waveform cycle alongside MIDI note names, cents, and frequency in Hz.
short_description: A pulsar VCO using wavetables for granular synthesis with independent pitch and formant controls.
use_cases: Timbre manipulation without affecting perceived pitch
gui_description: Displays a single waveform cycle of the current wavetable, stretched according to relative pitch and formant. Shows MIDI note name (with cents) and frequency in Hz.
